
### malware "signatures"

* typically can't rely on whitelisting approach 
   * software and related files change legitimately
   * and malware might not be in main executables
<hr class="vspace" />
* antivirus vendor have <em>signatures</em> for known malware
* many options to represent signatures
* thought process: <em>signature for Vienna?</em> 
<hr class="vspace" />
* goals: compact, fast to check, reliable
